content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the original and simplified passages

The passage:
First, at DC, Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP) is used to predict the probabilities of contents to be requested in specific areas.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The passage contains some technical terms and concepts such as "Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP)" and "probabilities of contents to be requested," which may be complex for a university student without a background in machine learning. Therefore, the complexity level of the passage is above the desired complexity (DC) for a university student.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The section "Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP)" is complicated due to its technical nature and the use of an acronym that may not be familiar to all university students.
Simplify this section
"Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP)" can be simplified to "a type of neural network used for predictions."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
First, at DC, a type of neural network used for predictions is used to predict the probabilities of contents to be requested in specific areas.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

The information loss from the updated passage is the specific term "Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP)" which provides a precise identification of the type of neural network being discussed. The severity of this loss is medium because while the term was simplified, the lack of the specific name may lead to a less clear understanding of the exact method being referred to. However, the core idea of using a neural network for predictions is retained. 

Since the severity of information loss is medium and acceptable within the ILT (Medium), the change can be accepted.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
If needed, adjust the passage to maintain readabily and flow of text
First, a type of neural network used for predictions is applied to estimate the probabilities of contents that will be requested in specific areas.
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage has been reduced and is now at a level that is more accessible for a university student. The term "a type of neural network used for predictions" is simpler and easier to understand than the original technical term. Overall, the current complexity level is appropriate for a university student.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Provide the final version of the simplified passage
First, a type of neural network used for predictions is applied to estimate the probabilities of contents that will be requested in specific areas.
